table-wrap-foot.p: Managerial Epidemiology Interpretation: A risk ratio less than 1.0 indicates that the outcome is less likely the study period than in the baseline period. The significant (a p-value of less than 0.001) “protective (or reduction)” effect (IRR = 0.34) of intervention reducing catheter-related bloodstream infections persisted as long as 18 months after the introduction of the intervention (incidence rate ratio of 0.34, 95% CI: 0.23–0.50, p < 0.001).
